channel.title: Tries in Word Games :: Data Structures in C#
channel.description: Tries in Word Games One application of tries is for implementing word games such as Boggle® or Scrabble®. This section discusses how a trie can be used to reduce dramatically the amount of time spent searching for words in such games. We will focus specifically on Boggle, but the same principles apply to other word games as well. A Boggle game consists of either 16 or 25 dice with letters on their faces, along with a tray containing a 4 x 4 or 5 x 5 grid for holding these dice. The face of each die contains a single letter, except that one face of one die contains “Qu”. The tray has a large cover such that the dice can be placed in the cover and the tray placed upside-down on top of the cover.
